abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Supporting Access to
            On-Site Sanitation Services through Output-Based Aid (OBA)
            Scheme Project for Senegal were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was moderately satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the technological options should
            not be too firmly set at the outset. Thus, in this case,
            one-quarter of the facilities ultimately built were options
            not originally proposed: connections to existing condominium
            systems and construction of the superstructure by
            beneficiaries themselves. It should be possible for the
            payment percentages going to various stakeholders (main
            contractor, social engineering, construction companies,
            etc.) to evolve during project implementation. The principle
            of full payment of the beneficiary's contribution
            before work can begin appears too rigid and does not
            encourage participation by the most underprivileged
            populations. Ways to spread out the contributions should be
            examined when future projects are implemented. This could be
            done either (i) through the project, with well defined
            requirements to be met, or (ii) by relying on microcredit
            organizations, with membership arrangements and repayment
            rates that do not excessively increase the size of the
            household contribution. The method of calculating the
            subsidy per facility should be absolutely explicit because
            this is an important indicator for monitoring the project.
            In this project, the project appraisal document, or PAD did
            not specify whether the subsidy ceiling was supposed to
            apply to each individual facility or rather, as an average
            figure, to all the facilities as a whole. This point should
            be spelled out clearly in upcoming projects.
